properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 7 at 11:35AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...

Big Creek below Hog Wallow Creek near Roswell affecting Fulton
County


.Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant runoff into streams and
rivers which will cause flooding in some areas.

The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flood Warning for
The Big Creek below Hog Wallow Creek near Roswell.
* From this morning until further notice.
* At 11 AM Friday the stage was 9.7 feet...and rising.
* Flood stage is 10 feet.
* At 10 feet...Flood Stage is reached.  Minor flooding of woodlands
and grassy areas begin along the creek upstream and downstream from
the gage off Oxbo Drive in the Roswell area.  Also high water
continues to encroach into the Big Creek Park two miles downstream
along Roswell Road and Riverside Road. If the Roswell gage on the
Chattahoochee River is 8 feet or higher...then the combination of
flows will cause the access road to the Huntcliff horse stables
across from Azalea Park to begin to flood.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interests along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...and be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property.

The latest stage data was furnished in cooperation with the United
States Geological Survey.
